content:
Wesley Wiser said:

Hi Vilda.

There's no issue with nightly and cargo-bisect-rustc seems to work only for nightly.

What you'll want to do is use a nightly build from around 12 weeks ago (which is when the current stable release branched off from nightly). That would be about 2021-12-01.

Hey,
so cargo bisect didn't help at all, it didn't find anything and always reported error when I set start and end flags. But thanks for pointing out that stable was at some point nightly. Should've realized myself.

Aaanyway I've found the culprit and it might be what you linked. When I try to build it with nightly-2021-12-08 it takes so long I've never seen it finished. But for nightly-2021-12-22 (which should be with merged PR you linked) it finishes in 5m.

Thanks again for help. I feel much more smarter now :D
Vilda has marked this topic as resolved.
Tho it still bugs me a bit that on MacOS this issue isn't present. But I won't be investigating this anymore and will use nightly for now.

@Vilda just FYI that fix is included in 1.59 which just released on the stable branch about an hour ago. So if you update the stable toolchain (rustup update stable) it should be resolved for you there as well.

@Wesley Wiser thanks for the info, I've tried it and it's great:
Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 2m 32s
Thanks @Aaron Hill for the fix :tada:
